justification: The paper mentions using the Berlin Intelligence Test to assess cognitive ability in a reanalysis of data from Löffler et al. (2024), providing a foundation for linking individual differences in cognitive abilities with diffusion model parameters.

topic_or_construct: Decision-making processes (drift rate, boundary separation, internal noise)
justification: The paper extensively discusses the use of the DDM to analyze decision-making processes, including interpretation of parameters like drift rate, boundary separation, and internal noise.

topic_or_construct: Individual differences in attention influence perceptual decision making
justification: The paper references work by Nunez, Vandekerckhove, and Srinivasan (2016) using single-trial EEG measures and DDM to investigate how attention influences perceptual decision making.

topic_or_construct: Cognitive ability-related differences in DDM parameters
measured_by: Signal-to-Noise Ratio (SNR), Criterion-to-Noise Ratio (CNR), Noise-to-Criterion Ratio (NCR), Signal-to-Criterion Ratio (SCR)
justification: The paper describes reparameterizing standard diffusion model parameters into derived quantities like SNR, CNR, NCR, and SCR to reveal stronger relationships with individual differences in cognitive abilities in an analysis of Löffler et al. (2024) data.
